articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police made multiple arrests Feb. 12–13 including DUII cases, several warrant arrests, harassment, and prohibited camping enforcement. Incidents ranged from traffic stops and disturbances to a parole absconding arrest at the VA, according to the latest city police logs.
articles.title: Police Log: February 12, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Two Fremont Middle School staff members were arrested Thursday in connection with an investigation involving reported injuries to students in a specialized classroom program, according to Roseburg Schools. The district says it is cooperating with law enforcement as the investigation continues.
articles.title: Two Fremont Middle School Staff Arrested; District Confirms Active Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Vacant to Vibrant is hosting free community art workshops in Roseburg and Oakland to create “Portraits of Community,” a public installation filling vacant storefronts this summer. Residents are invited to attend March and April drop-in sessions to help make the art.
articles.title: Community Art Project to Transform Vacant Storefronts in Roseburg and Oakland

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Umpqua Actors Community Theatre’s Father-Daughter Dance returns Feb. 20 at the Douglas County Fairgrounds in Roseburg. The evening includes music, dancing, photos and refreshments for dads and daughters. Tickets are $20 per person and available while space lasts.
articles.title: Father-Daughter Dance returns to Douglas County Fairgrounds for 2026 - Tickets Still Available

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Sutherlin School District has appointed Sutherlin High School Principal Jon Martz as superintendent starting July 1. The school board approved the hire after a search process. Martz will replace retiring superintendent Terry Prestianni and lead a district serving about 1,300 students.
articles.title: Sutherlin School District Selects Next Superintendent

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Umpqua National Forest plans to hire seasonal workers for summer, with openings expected Feb. 20. Jobs in recreation, trails and resource management will be based in Glide, Roseburg, Tiller and Idleyld Park. Applicants must be 18 and apply through USAJOBS.
articles.title: Umpqua National Forest preparing to hire seasonal workers for summer
